title: How do I read and write data from a text file?

sections.title: Symptoms
content: • I want to read and write data from a text file that can be in a specific directory or among my other Assets.

sections.title: Resolution
content: If you don’t want to read the file from a directory, you can assign the Asset directly from the Editor using an exposed property of type TextAsset (as you can see in Figure 1) and get the text of the file the using the TextAsset.text property.
Figure 1. Text file assigned to a TextAsset

Another way to read and write data from a text file that’s in a specific directory is to use the StreamWriter and StreamReader classes from the System.IO namespace to access characters from a byte stream and then load the file as a TextAsset in Unity.
